flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: First, I drilled a hole in a plank of wood and attached a old light holder I have to it. Then I ran thepower cable through a clamp and then used 2 clamps to hold it in place.
lines.text_raw: First, I drilled a hole in a plank of wood and attached a old light holder I have to it. Then I ran thepower cable through a clamp and then used 2 clamps to hold it in place.

lines.text: After that i attached clips to hold my tools and my power cable. i also mounted my multimeter on the bottom of my workbench. then i attached the multimeter and a power supply to screws on my desk.
lines.text_raw: After that i attached clips to hold my tools and my power cable. i also mounted my multimeter on the bottom of my workbench. then i attached the multimeter and a power supply to screws on my desk.

lines.text: I also used a old antenna and a chain to make a extendable magnifying glass.
lines.text_raw: I also used a old antenna and a chain to make a extendable magnifying glass.

guide.summary: This guide shows how to build a awesome workbench that has a extendable magnifying glass, a good light source, and a built in multimeter. I am still working on adding more. It also has clips holding wires and tools.
guide.title: Awesome Workbench
